intro: Langevinia monosperma, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. The plant is often found in shrublands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
